section: cstr.h inc/cstr/cstr.h Go to the documentation of this file.00001 // cstr.h 00002 00003 #pragma once 00004 00005 #include "CSTRpredefines.h" 00006 00007 #ifdef __CSTR_OK 00008 # undef __CSTR_OK 00009 #endif // defined(__CSTR_OK) 00010 00011 #if __STDC_VERSION__ >= CSTR_DEFAULT_C_STD 00012 00013 #include <stdbool.h> 00014 #include <stdlib.h> 00015 00016 #define CSTR_NPOS -1 00017 #define CSTR_SUCCESS 0 00018 #define CSTR_FAIL 1 00019 #define CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 2 00020 00021 // NOTE: Dear developer, check all the available macros here 00022 #ifdef CSTR_RECOMMENDED 00023 # define CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY 00024 # define CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN 00025 # define CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN 00026 #endif // CSTR_RECOMMENDED 00027 00028 // NOTE: 00029 // Other macros that are not recommended but available for flexibility are: 00030 // CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL : Define the internal files inside of the header file (cstr.h) 00031 // Check the definitions below the definition of the CSTR struct 00032 // CSTR_RECOMMENDED : Enable recommended macros, such as CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY, CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN, ... 00033 00034 /** 00035 * @brief Custom dynamic string type 00036 * 00037 * The fields should typically be managed only through the cstr_* API 00038 * Directly modifying them can lead to undefined behavior unless explicitly intended 00039 */ 00040 typedef struct 00041 { 00042 /** 00043 * @brief Tracks whether this CSTR has been initialized 00044 * @note Should only be set by internal or initialization functions 00045 */ 00046 bool initialized; 00047 00048 /** 00049 * @brief Pointer to the character buffer 00050 * Always NULL terminated if properly managed through the API 00051 */ 00052 char *data; 00053 00054 /** 00055 * @brief If true, capacity is fixed and operations that exceed 00056 * it return an error instead of reallocating the size 00057 */ 00058 bool forceCap; 00059 00060 /** 00061 * @brief Current string length (not counting the NULL terminator) 00062 */ 00063 size_t len; 00064 00065 /** 00066 * @brief Total allocated capacity (including NULL terminator) 00067 */ 00068 size_t cap; 00069 } CSTR; 00070 00071 #ifdef CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL 00072 /** 00073 * @brief Update the capacity automatically 00074 * IMPORTANT: 00075 * This function won't do anything if macro `CSTR_DYNAMIC_CAPACITY` is NOT defined 00076 * 00077 * @return Return if fail or success 00078 * @note Typically used in the other defined functions for CSTR inner API 00079 */ 00080 int __cstr_updateCap(CSTR *_str); 00081 00082 /** 00083 * @brief Internal helper to format and set the string content. 00084 * 00085 * Uses a printf-style format string and variadic arguments to 00086 * overwrite the content of a CSTR. The function computes the 00087 * required buffer size, reallocates if needed (unless forceCap 00088 * is active), formats the string, and updates length/capacity. 00089 * 00090 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify. 00091 * @param _fmt printf-style format string. 00092 * @param ... Variadic arguments corresponding to the format. 00093 * 00094 * @return 00095 * - CSTR_SUCCESS on success 00096 * - CSTR_FAIL if parameters are invalid, allocation fails, 00097 * or vsnprintf reports an error 00098 * - CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT if forceCap is enabled and the 00099 * required size exceeds current capacity 00100 * 00101 * @note Typically used in the other defined functions for CSTR inner API 00102 */ 00103 static int __cstr_setFormat(CSTR *_str, const char *_fmt, ...); 00104 #endif // defined(CSTR_DEFINE_INTERNAL) 00105 00106 /** 00107 * @brief Initialize a new empty CSTR 00108 * 00109 * @return A new CSTR instance. Check `.initialized` or if CSTR is not NULL to confirm success 00110 */ 00111 CSTR cstr_init(void); 00112 00113 /** 00114 * @brief Initialize a CSTR with a copy of an original C-string 00115 * 00116 * @param _dest Pointer to the destination CSTR 00117 * @param _src NULL terminated string to copy from 00118 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS on success, otherwise CSTR_FAIL 00119 */ 00120 int cstr_initCopy(CSTR *_dest, const char *_src); 00121 00122 /** 00123 * @brief Destroy and clean up a CSTR and its allocated objects 00124 * 00125 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to destroy 00126 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS on success, otherwise CSTR_FAIL 00127 */ 00128 int cstr_destroy(CSTR *_str); 00129 00130 /** 00131 * @brief Set the content of a CSTR to a new C-string in `.data` 00132 * 00133 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00134 * @param _data Null terminated string to set 00135 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00136 */ 00137 int cstr_set(CSTR *_str, const char *_data); 00138 00139 /** 00140 * @brief Append a suffix to the end of a CSTR 00141 * 00142 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00143 * @param _suffix NULL terminated string to append 00144 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00145 */ 00146 int cstr_add(CSTR *_str, const char *_suffix); 00147 00148 /** 00149 * @brief Extract a substring in place from a CSTR 00150 * 00151 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00152 * @param _start Starting index of the substring 00153 * @param _len Length of the substring 00154 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00155 */ 00156 int cstr_substr(CSTR *_str, size_t _start, size_t _len); 00157 00158 /** 00159 * @brief Clear a CSTR to an empty string without freeing memory 00160 * 00161 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to clear 00162 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00163 */ 00164 int cstr_clear(CSTR *_str); 00165 00166 /** 00167 * @brief Convert all characters in a CSTR to uppercase 00168 * 00169 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00170 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00171 */ 00172 int cstr_upper(CSTR *_str); 00173 00174 /** 00175 * @brief Convert all characters in a CSTR to lowercase 00176 * 00177 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00178 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00179 */ 00180 int cstr_lower(CSTR *_str); 00181 00182 /** 00183 * @brief Insert a string at a specific position in a CSTR 00184 * 00185 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00186 * @param _data NULL terminated string to insert 00187 * @param _pos Position at which to insert, 0-based 00188 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS, CSTR_FAIL, or CSTR_FORCECAP_LIMIT 00189 */ 00190 int cstr_insert(CSTR *_str, const char *_data, size_t _pos); 00191 00192 /** 00193 * @brief Reverse the content of a CSTR in place 00194 * 00195 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to modify 00196 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00197 */ 00198 int cstr_reverse(CSTR *_str); 00199 00200 /** 00201 * @brief Clear the content of a CSTR and optionally shrink capacity 00202 * 00203 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to shrink 00204 * @param _len New length (characters to keep) 00205 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00206 */ 00207 int cstr_shrink(CSTR *_str, const size_t _len); 00208 00209 /** 00210 * @brief Create a numeric string from an integer 00211 */ 00212 int cstr_fromInt(CSTR *_str, int _val); 00213 00214 /** 00215 * @brief Create a numeric string from a long 00216 */ 00217 int cstr_fromLong(CSTR *_str, long _val); 00218 00219 /** 00220 * @brief Create a numeric string from a float 00221 */ 00222 int cstr_fromFloat(CSTR *_str, float _val); 00223 00224 /** 00225 * @brief Create a numeric string from a double 00226 */ 00227 int cstr_fromDouble(CSTR *_str, double _val); 00228 00229 /** 00230 * @brief Create a hexadecimal string from an unsigned integer 00231 */ 00232 int cstr_fromHex(CSTR *_str, unsigned int _val); 00233 00234 /** 00235 * @brief Replace only the first occurrence of a substring 00236 * 00237 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00238 * @param _old Substring to locate 00239 * @param _new Replacement string 00240 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or an error code (CSTR_FAIL, ...) 00241 */ 00242 int cstr_replace(CSTR *_str, const char *_old, const char *_new); 00243 00244 /** 00245 * @brief Replace all occurrences of a substring 00246 * 00247 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00248 * @param _old Substring to locate 00249 * @param _new Replacement string 00250 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00251 */ 00252 int cstr_replaceAll(CSTR *_str, const char *_old, const char *_new); 00253 00254 /** 00255 * @brief Erase a portion of the string 00256 * 00257 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR 00258 * @param _pos Starting position 00259 * @param _len Number of characters to remove 00260 * @return CSTR_SUCCESS or CSTR_FAIL 00261 */ 00262 int cstr_erase(CSTR *_str, int _pos, size_t _len); 00263 00264 /** 00265 * @brief Find the first occurrence of a substring 00266 * 00267 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to search 00268 * @param _find Substring to locate 00269 * @return Index of first match, or CSTR_NPOS if not found 00270 */ 00271 size_t cstr_find(const CSTR *_str, const char *_find); 00272 00273 /** 00274 * @brief Find a substring starting from a specific index 00275 * 00276 * @param _str Pointer to the CSTR to search 00277 * @param _find Substring to locate 00278 * @param pos Starting index 00279 * @return Index of match, or CSTR_NPOS if not found 00280 */ 00281 size_t cstr_findFrom(const CSTR *_str, const char *_find, size_t pos); 00282 00283 /** 00284 * @brief Check if a CSTR begins with the given prefix 00285 * 00286 * @param _str The CSTR to check by value 00287 * @param _prefix The prefix string 00288 * @return true if it starts with prefix, else return false 00289 */ 00290 bool cstr_startsWith(CSTR _str, const char *_prefix); 00291 00292 /** 00293 * @brief Check if a CSTR ends with the given suffix 00294 * 00295 * @param _str The CSTR to check (by value) 00296 * @param _suffix The suffix string 00297 * @return true if it ends with suffix, false otherwise 00298 */ 00299 bool cstr_endsWith(const CSTR _str, const char *_suffix); 00300 00301 /** 00302 * @brief Compare two CSTR instances for equality 00303 * 00304 * @param _s1 First CSTR (by value) 00305 * @param _s2 Second CSTR (by value) 00306 * @return true if equal, false otherwise 00307 */ 00308 bool cstr_comp(const CSTR _s1, const CSTR _s2); 00309 00310 /** 00311 * @brief Return "true" or "false" based on a boolean value 00312 * 00313 * @param _bool Boolean value 00314 * @return "true" if _bool is true, otherwise "false". 00315 */ 00316 const char *cstr_bool(const bool _bool); 00317 00318 /** 00319 * @brief Get if the string is empty 00320 * Return true if: 00321 * `.len` smaller or equal to 0 00322 * `.data` is empty ("") 00323 * `.initialized` is false 00324 * `_str` is NULL 00325 * If none of the requirements are met, means that it's not empty, hence, return false 00326 * 00327 * @return Is the string empty? Yes (true), No (false) 00328 */ 00329 bool cstr_empty(const CSTR *_str); 00330 00331 #define __CSTR_OK 00332 00333 #ifdef __CSTR_OK 00334 # ifdef CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN 00335 # define CSTR_GET_RETURN(_cstr, _call, ...) ((_call(&_cstr, __VA_ARGS__)), _cstr) 00336 # else 00337 # define CSTR_GET_RETURN(_cstr, _call, ...) 00338 # endif // defined(CSTR_ENABLE_GET_RETURN) 00339 00340 # ifdef CSTR_CONST_RETURN_USE_PTR_METHOD 00341 # define CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD -> 00342 # else 00343 # define CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD . 00344 # endif 00345 00346 # ifdef CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN 00347 # define CSTR_GET_CONST_RETURN(_str, _call, ...) \ 00348 ({ \ 00349 CSTR tmpS; \ 00350 cstr_initCopy(&tmpS, _str CSTR_CONST_RETURN_PTR_METHOD data); \ 00351 _call(&tmpS, __VA_ARGS__); \ 00352 tmpS; \ 00353 }) 00354 # else 00355 # define CSTR_GET_CONST_RETURN(_str, _call, ...) 00356 # endif // defined(CSTR_ENABLE_GET_CONST_RETURN) 00357 #endif // __CSTR_OK 00358 00359 #else 00360 # error "Must use C11 as the minimum standard" 00361 #endif // __STDC_VERSION__ 00362
